H0.text: Homeostasis is the term for the relatively stable state inside the body of an animal.

H1.text: Metabolism is the relatively stable state inside the body of an animal.

H2.text: Dormancy is the term for the relatively stable state inside the body of an animal.

H3.text: Consciousness is the term for the relatively stable state inside the body of an animal.

A4.text: In biology, homeostasis (British also homoeostasis;  HOH-mee-É™-STAY-sis) is the state of steady internal physical and chemical conditions maintained by living systems.

A5.text: Each of these variables is controlled by one or more regulators or homeostatic mechanisms, which together maintain life.
